alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 5:33PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...This includes portions of northern Catron and southern Cibola counties in western New Mexico. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the last hour. This rainfall is in addition to the 1 to 1.5 inches of rainfall that fell earlier today in this area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pietown and Omega. Ponding water is possible along Highways 36 and 117. - This also includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 43 and 61.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remember, ditches are deadly. A gentle flow of water can become a raging torrent in a few minutes.
